maml:description.maml:para: Make a connection to the CIS service on the vCenter
Make a connection to the CIS service on the vCenter. Credentials need to be provided.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
A PSCredential object with a user and password that is allowed to connect to the CIS service.
Connects to a Fiddler instance on the station where the cmdlet is executed. Used for debugging purposes.
When the vCenter is located behind a proxy, specify the proxy.
The hostname of the vCenter
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Connects to a Fiddler instance on the station where the cmdlet is executed. Used for debugging purposes.
The user's password
When the vCenter is located behind a proxy, specify the proxy.
The hostname of the vCenter
The user to connect to the CIS service
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Connects to a Fiddler instance on the station where the cmdlet is executed. Used for debugging purposes.

When the vCenter is located behind a proxy, specify the proxy.
The hostname of the vCenter
The user to connect to the CIS service
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connect to the CIS service on vCenter vcsa.domain.org with user administrator@vsphere.local
Connect to the CIS service on vCenter vcsa.domain.org with the PSCredential stored in $cred

maml:description.maml:para: Closes the open connection to the CIS REST API
Closes the open connection to the Cis REST API on the host passed on the Server parameter.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the server on which the Cis REST API was opened.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name of the server on which the Cis REST API was opened.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Closes the connection to the server vcsa.domain.org

maml:description.maml:para: Return one or more Tag Categories

The Tag Category Id

maml:description.maml:para: Create a Tag in one or more Categories, optionally with a Description

The name of the Category in which to create the Tag
An optional Description for the Tag

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a Tag named MyTag in the Category MyCategory
Creates a Tag named MyTag in all Categories

command:example.maml:title: Example 3
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-rCisCategory -Name MyCategory | New-rCisTag -Name MyTag -Description 'Text'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a Tag named MyTag in the Category MyCategory. And add the Description 'Text' to the Tag.

The name of the Entity or the PowerCLI object for the entity

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Tag Category. The user can define the Cardinality of the Tag Catgeory (default Single), add a description to the Tag Category and specify for which entity types the Tag Category can be used.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the new Tag Category
Defines the Cardinality of the Tags in this Tag Category. Possible values are Single (default) and Multiple.
A description that is attached to the Tag Category
The type of Entity/Entities to which Tags in this Tag Category can be attached.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Defines the Cardinality of the Tags in this Tag Category. Possible values are Single (default) and Multiple.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
A description that is attached to the Tag Category
The type of Entity/Entities to which Tags in this Tag Category can be attached.
The name of the new Tag Category
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new Tag Category named MyCat

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-rCisTagCategory -Name MyCat -Cardinality Multiple -Description 'My Category'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new Tag Category named MyCat, with a Cardinality of Multiple and a description.
